metadata.description: Career function alignments and entrepreneurship suitability by pattern

rating_scale.5: Exceptional fit - natural strengths align perfectly
rating_scale.3: Good fit - capable with some adaptation
rating_scale.1: Poor fit - fundamental mismatch with core behaviors

rating_scale.4: Strong entrepreneurial potential with right co-founder
rating_scale.2: Better as employee or in stable small business

rankings.rationale: Natural-born founder; self-reliant, thrives on challenge, comfortable with risk
Drive + charisma to recruit teams and sell vision
Classic CEO profile; sells vision AND executes with balanced D/I
Technical founder archetype; innovates but may struggle with team-building
Can sell anything; needs detail-oriented co-founder for execution
Strong accountability; better as co-founder/COO than solo founder
Can found consulting/service businesses; needs structure for scale
Great at networking/fundraising; needs operational partner urgently
Deep-tech startups possible; struggles with sales side
Coaching/therapy practices work; not suited for high-growth startups
Strong technical contributor if paired with D/I co-founder
Prefers supportive roles; uncomfortable with founder pressure
Too conflict-averse for startup volatility and tough decisions
Prefers stability; startup chaos is antithetical to core needs
Needs predictability; hostile to entrepreneurial risk and ambiguity

people_management.description: Roles centered on leading and developing teams

process_execution.description: Roles focused on reliable, consistent delivery

creative_innovation.description: Roles requiring novel thinking and experimentation

analytical_technical.description: Roles demanding precision and systematic thinking

customer_facing.description: Roles requiring interpersonal engagement and service

D_family_progression.early_career: Individual contributor roles with autonomy and challenge
D_family_progression.mid_career: Project leadership, business unit management, entrepreneurship
D_family_progression.avoid: Long-term routine work, heavily collaborative roles without authority

I_family_progression.mid_career: Sales leadership, marketing management, people development
I_family_progression.senior_career: Chief revenue officer, chief people officer, culture leadership
I_family_progression.avoid: Isolated technical work, extensive detail work, solo contributor roles

S_family_progression.early_career: Specialized roles with clear processes and supportive teams
S_family_progression.mid_career: Operations management, team leadership, quality assurance
S_family_progression.senior_career: Chief operating officer, servant leadership, organizational stability
S_family_progression.avoid: High-pressure sales, constant change environments, startup chaos

C_family_progression.early_career: Technical specialist, analyst, quality control roles
C_family_progression.mid_career: Subject matter expertise, technical leadership, process architecture
C_family_progression.senior_career: Chief technology officer, chief financial officer, technical fellow
C_family_progression.avoid: Highly political environments, rapid iteration roles, people-heavy management

Technology_Startups.why: Requires innovation, risk tolerance, rapid execution

Healthcare_Services.why: Requires empathy, consistency, attention to detail, stability

Finance_Banking.why: Requires analytical rigor, risk management, accuracy

Sales_Business_Development.why: Requires social skills, competitive drive, persuasion

Creative_Industries.why: Requires innovation, aesthetic judgment, social awareness

Operations_Manufacturing.why: Requires consistency, process adherence, quality control
